image.altText: Young boy in bucket hat and girl wearing garden gloves and leaning over planter beds

props.synopsis: Residents at an affordable apartment complex in Adelaide are taking part in a greening project intended to improve the wellbeing of young people who have spent time in state care, and reduce the amount of heat trapped in urban spaces.

title.children: For a young couple at risk of homelessness, a community garden is helping hope bloom

image.altText: A colourful box for the ordering of candidates in South Australia's First Nations Voice to Parliament elections.

props.synopsis: Four elected members and a senior staff member have resigned months after South Australia's inaugural First Nations Voice to Parliament elections were held, with one outgoing leader describing the model as "unsustainable".

title.children: SA's First Nations Voice to Parliament hit by resignations amid concerns about 'unsustainable' model

image.altText: A close up for a smiling man's face.

props.synopsis: The family of father of four Joe Koumera has been left waiting for answers after he died in the Riverland in October.

title.children: Family waiting for answers after death of PALM worker in SA

image.altText: Yuto Akihiro swings a baseball bat while standing in a grass field

props.synopsis: The tallest Japanese professional baseball player in history — standing at just over 2 metres tall — has joined the Adelaide Giants as the club aims to win a third straight Australian Baseball League championship.

title.children: Japan's tallest baseball player joins Giants for Australian season

image.altText: A group of people hold up university certificates.

props.synopsis: Former electronics engineer Artem Vasilyev, who was in the process of being "radicalised" by "extremist right-wing ideologies" when he was arrested, is sentenced to at least three years in prison where he has already made "good friends", a judge says.

title.children: Ex-defence employee whose right-wing radicalisation was 'terminated' by arrest sentenced for firearms offences

image.altText: The Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby wears a purple top and chain with a cross as he walks in Westminster

props.synopsis: A man who survived abuse as a child at the hands of his Anglican priest says the Church should "beg" for forgiveness after it a report revealed that the Archbishop of Canterbury had knowledge of sexual abuse at Christian camps.

title.children: Child abuse survivor says Anglican Church should have learnt from Australia's Royal Commission

image.altText: Will Brown

props.synopsis: The Adelaide 500 motorsport carnival kicks off today on a street circuit revered across the globe, as past legends recall the inaugural event held in 1999 and what made it so special.

title.children: From a 'barmy' concept to 'benchmark' event for the Supercars, Adelaide 500 celebrates 25 years

image.altText: An underwater photo of a giant kelp forest.

props.synopsis: A global report into kelp forests has found they are under threat from climate change and conservationists are concerned the vital underwater ecosystems on Australia's coastline are not getting the attention they need.

title.children: Loss of vital underwater forests happening 'out of sight, out of mind', marine experts say

image.altText: Adnyamathanha elder Uncle Charles Jackson.

props.synopsis: It has been almost one month since Port Augusta became a Declared Public Precinct, but Uncle Charles Jackson OAM says the move simply shifts the issues "out of sight".

title.children: 'It's directed at First Nations people': Elder shares concerns about Declared Public Precinct in Port Augusta

image.altText: A middle-aged man stands beside a creek which has hazard signs on it

props.synopsis: Remnants of the Millennium drought regulator have been discovered in the only water inlet and outlet of Lake Bonney in SA's Riverland, frustrating locals who say the slab was dangerous to water users.

title.children: Huge concrete slab found in SA lake despite government claims it was removed a decade earlier

image.altText: Koala sitting on a bed inside a house.

props.synopsis: Something soft and cuddly on a bed can be a welcome sight if that something is inanimate, like a pillow — but in the early hours of Wednesday morning an Adelaide couple were forced to contend with a friendly, if unexpected, intruder.

title.children: 'We believe he came through the dog door': Koala sitting on bed startles couple on return from work

image.altText: Fisherman leaning up against a boat

props.synopsis: Some South Australian fishers are worried recreational catches are skewing the data on fish stocks, as amateurs aren't subject to the same regulations.

title.children: Professional fishers call for amateurs to get a licence to cast a line

image.altText: Two men in a suit at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Albanese government is pushing for the biggest shake-up of funding and disclosure laws in more than a decade.

title.children: Labor unveils its plan to end political 'arms race', with clamps on Clive Palmer, Climate 200

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses and clutching a designer handbag lies on a sun loung and waves a hand and a leg in the air

props.synopsis: There is a list of high-profile Trump loyalists who will land positions in his White House, but this week Mar-a-Lago was crawling with other MAGA faithful who want a presidential treat too.

title.children: 'House of Cards on the lido deck': West Wing hopefuls flock to Mar-a-Lago

image.altText: Mohamed Al Fayed wears a blue pin-stripped suit looking neutrally below the camera's line

props.synopsis: The three women have told the BBC that they were also assaulted by both Mohamed Al Fayed and Salah Fayed, with one alleging she was raped.

title.children: Mohamed Al Fayed's brother accused of sexually assaulting three former Harrods store workers

image.altText: Teenage students solve maths problems in workbooks.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has ordered another investigation — and revealed plans for an independent monitor — following yet another year 12 VCE exam bungle.

title.children: Curriculum body to face full review after 2024 VCE exams blunder

image.altText: A group of people watching from the street as a plume of smoke rises from behind an apartment building.

props.synopsis: An Israeli government minister says the country is close to a deal that would see fighting cease in Lebanon, but only if it is granted powers to respond to any Hezbollah incursions.

title.children: Israel and Hezbollah are ready for a truce, but a major sticking point remains

image.altText: A hand can be seen in the foreground holding a bottle and a dropper full of THC oil. Marijuana buds are surrounding the bottle.

props.synopsis: Medicinal marijuana has been legal in Australia for several years now, but when could an employee lose their job for testing positive for the drug in the workplace?

title.children: Nearly a million Australians have used medicinal marijuana since it became legal. But is it allowed at work?

image.altText: A screenshot from a website listing a tractor for sale with a giant red FAKE stamp on top

props.synopsis: These farmers bought used tractors from a website that looked like the real deal. Instead, they fell into a trap laid by scammers using a Russian-linked website to pose as a legitimate Sydney-based business.

title.children: How a Russian-linked website is scamming Australians out of tens of thousands of dollars for fake tractors

image.altText: Infowars founder Alex Jones looking sideways, wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Alex Jones owes $1.5 billion after defaming the families of those killed in the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School shootings, claiming it was a hoax staged by crisis actors.

title.children: The Onion buys conspiracy website Infowars after $1.5b ruling against founder Alex Jones

image.altText: Mike Tyson looks to one side

props.synopsis: Mike Tyson is 58 years old, but will still step back into the ring in a professionally sanctioned bout, taking on YouTuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul.

title.children: Mike Tyson's return to boxing's blood-soaked theatre an unacceptable risk

image.altText: A car boot full of groceries.

props.synopsis: As wet season looms in northern Australia, the stockpiling of food in pantries and freezers is underway. Here's how the experts prepare for the big wet.

title.children: This grazier's shopping list hasn’t changed much since 1986 — 34kg of flour, 26kg of sugar, four litres of tomato sauce

image.altText: A woman looking at medical pamphlets in a chemist

props.synopsis: A pilot program allowing women to get the contraceptive pill directly from a pharmacist is supposed to improve accessibility, but some Queensland women believe it's not as easy or cheap as originally announced.

title.children: A Queensland pilot program was supposed to make it easier to access the contraceptive pill, but now it's being questioned

image.altText: Two small fish with silvery blue scales and red colouring.

props.synopsis: The largest survey of Australia's freshwater fish suggests about one third should be listed as threatened species.

title.children: Scientists say 35 freshwater fish species should be added to the threatened species list

image.altText: A gun coloured  white and blue

props.synopsis: The 28-year-old has been taken to Mascot Police Station and charged with possessing an unauthorised firearm.

title.children: Rideshare driver charged and water pistol seized following alleged shooting of replica gun in Sydney's CBD

image.altText: A close up for a smiling man's face.

props.synopsis: The family of father of four Joe Koumera has been left waiting for answers after he died in the Riverland in October.

title.children: Family waiting for answers after death of PALM worker in SA

image.altText: A close-up of an orange electricity cable plugged into a car.

props.synopsis: Vehicle-to-grid charging promises to save households money and get more value out of EV batteries. Here's how to take advantage of "V2G".

title.children: You may soon be able to power a house with an EV battery, but not every car will be compatible

image.altText: People wearing body paint and animal skins participate in a cultural performance.

props.synopsis: More than a year after one of Australia's more controversial referendums, "where to from here?" is a question many continue to ask. But there are hopes truth-telling will help to heal deep wounds in Western Australia.

title.children: After the failed Voice referendum, here's how truth-telling will help reconciliation in WA

image.altText: An shadowy portrait of Gamitj man and Yolgnu musician Gurrumul posing in a suit with his arms crossed his chest.

props.synopsis: Posthumous albums are typically cynical, cash-grabbing affairs. Not so Banbirrngu - The Orchestra Sessions, a meditative reappraisal of Gurrumul's voice and musical legacy made by two of his closest collaborators.

title.children: Seven years on from his death, Gurrumul's voice and music live on in new orchestral album

image.altText: Purple e-scooter parked on footpath with two other people riding on others.

props.synopsis: Mylie Campbell says e-transport riders who speed and break other safety laws don't seem to realise the full extent of injuries that can come from even a minor crash.

title.children: Unsafe e-scooter riders frustrate crash survivor amid call for targeted crackdown

image.altText: A woman in a blue dress smiles while holding up a glass award.

props.synopsis: The co-founder of an organisation helping children experiencing serious injury or illness avoid missing out on school, Megan Gilmour, is named 2025 Australian of the Year for the ACT.

title.children: After Megan's son missed over a year of school while chronically ill she promised not to turn her back on others like him

props.synopsis: As parliamentarians gathered for a preliminary vote on the bill on Thursday, Te Pāti Māori MPs physically tore a copy of the bill, stood and began a haka.

title.children: New Zealand Parliament suspended after haka protest

image.altText: Silhouette of children in the Kimberley on a beach at sunset.

props.synopsis: Advocates call for urgent action to implement a commissioner for young people in New South Wales, with First Nations children 12 times more likely to be in out-of-home care.

title.children: 'Everything was such a shock to me': The reality behind the rising number of out-of-home children

image.altText: A large bonfire lights up the night with twisted branches going up in flames and smoke.

props.synopsis: Push it over. Pile it up. Strike a match. That's been the fate of thousands of avocado trees as growers destroy entire paddocks in search of more profitable crops.

title.children: Bulldozers rip out thousands of avocado trees amid Far North orchard exodus
